pr_title: Added configurable http listeners for controller API

timeline.bodyText:
Does it make sense to do something like:
controller.access.protocol = "http" (or, "https", or "http,https")
and then have specific configs for the protocol as:
controller.access.protocol.<yourConfiguredProtocol>.<protocol-specific-config>
There is already a controller.host, so I suggest we just keep that to be the same, for existing cloud installations. Otherwise, they will need to specify the same host name in multiple places. The host name is either specified or inferred, there are not any other combinations of this.  We can then leave the logic in ControllerStarter.inferHostNameifNeeded() as it is instead of looking at 3 other settings?
timeline.author: mcvsubbu

replies.bodyText: +1 on @mcvsubbu 's suggestion. It should be either http or https.
replies.author: jackjlli

timeline.message:
Added configurable Opt-In http listeners for controller API

Introduction of new properties:
  controller.access.protocols=<comma seperated protocols http/https>
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.port=9443
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.host=0.0.0.0
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.vip=false
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.tls.keystore.path=some-path
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.tls.keystore.password=pass
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.tls.requires_client_auth=false
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.tls.truststore.path=some-path
  controller.access.protocols.<protocol>.tls.truststore.password=pass

Only the 'port' property will be mandatory if a protocol is activated
through controller.access.protcols

The existing 'controller.port property' is still expected by CLI. These
new properties are opt-in and can be activated with legacy
'controller.port' for backward compatibility.
